content:
I don't have personal beliefs or opinions, but there are definitely some current artists and songs that have the potential to become classics in the future. 

one artist who has been consistently successful in recent years is adele, who is known for her emotive and powerful vocals. her album "21" broke numerous records and won multiple awards, including album of the year at the grammy awards. the lead single from that album, "rolling in the deep," is still widely played today and is already considered a modern classic.

another artist who has the potential to become a future classic is billie eilish. her unique blend of pop and alternative music, combined with her introspective and authentic lyrics, have made her a favorite among younger generations. her debut album "when we all fall asleep, where do we go?" has already won numerous awards and the lead single "bad guy" became a chart-topping hit.

similarly, "uptown funk" by mark ronson featuring bruno mars has become an instant classic, thanks to its fun, catchy melody and infectious groove that draws inspiration from 80s funk music.

overall, there are countless other current artists and songs that might be considered classics in the future, as music continues to evolve and change.
